text:
It would be _very_ helpful for any new features added to the documentation to 
contain some sort of "since" comments.  This would allow an ant user to only 
keep one version of the ant documentation available but easily determine what 
features are available on prior versions.  Many open-source projects that use 
ant require a minimum ant version for their build process, and that ant version 
is usually not the current ant version available.
creator: thierry.lach@bbdodetroit.com
rxh@gers.com
text:
I'd just like to add an example of how helpful this information would be.
At this URL: 
http://devedge.netscape.com/library/manuals/2000/javascript/1.5/reference/array.
html#1193137

You can easily see when the feature was implemented and what type of 
enhancements were added in other versions.

I second this request; at least for every task the doco should
give the lowest Ant version where this task surfaced first (similar to the 
since fieldin the Javadocs). This helps a lot to write "portable" build files
without having to keep many versions of the Ant Manual around...

The proposed solution goes a step further trying to document even changes
in task attributes/subelements (at least that's how I understand it), but
having a since field for every task would be a promising start...
creator: landers@in.tum.de

text:
Maybe the @since comment can be used for set<attribute>() and 
add|create<nestedElement>() also. So it can be used for generating the doko via 
XDoclet. (There was a discussion about that generation, I guess.)
creator: jan@materne.de
mbenson@apache.org
text:
This is a request whose implementation is an ongoing process.  Present
 custom in Ant's Java source is to add @since javadoc tags in the Java source 
at the class level for new classes and at the method level for new 
attributes/elements.  In the manual, similarly, new tasks and types are labeled 
at the page level while new attributes and elements are directly labeled with 
some form of "since" notation.
